page.title: 02HISTORY OF GARSTANG
page.content: The Canal basin was built in 1711 and now runs from Glasson Dock to Preston. The Royal Oak Hotel was an important resting place on the London to Edinburgh route.Garstang can boast a total of 13 coach houses past and present,these are:FARMERS ARMS,THE CROWNWHEATSHEAF,KING'S ARMS,EAGLE AND CHILD,CHURCH INN,BLUE ANCHOR,SWAN,BROWN COW,SHOVEL AND BROOM,GOLDEN BALL,HORNS INN AND THE PACKHORSE.They were also a feature of the old markets when horses were run up the High Street ready for sale,along with the cattle , all very thirsty work.Thomas' Weind is an old right of way and had a great variety of buisnesses.Greenhalgh Castle was built in 1490 by Thomas Stanley,only a crumbling tower remains.During the Civil war it was bombarded and the loose stone used in farm buildings. By Junior 4 G.C.P.School.
